verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:1
verses.text: II.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:2
verses.text: —The Testament of Simeon Concerning Envy.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:3
verses.text: The copy of the words of Simeon, what things he spake to his sons before he died, in the hundred and twentieth year of his life, in the year in which Joseph died.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:4
verses.text: For they came to visit him when he was sick, and he strengthened himself and sat up and kissed them, and said to them:—.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:5
verses.text: Hear, O my children, hear Simeon your father, what things I have in my heart.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:6
verses.text: I was born of Jacob my father, his second son; and my mother Leah called me Simeon, because the Lord heard her prayer.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:7
verses.text: I became strong exceedingly; I shrank from no deed, nor was I afraid of anything.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:8
verses.text: For my heart was hard, and my mind was unmoveable, and my bowels unfeeling:  because valour also has been given from the Most High to men in soul and in body.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:9
verses.text: And at that time I was jealous of Joseph because our father loved him; and I set my mind against him to destroy him, because the prince of deceit sent forth the spirit of jealousy and blinded my mind, that I regarded him not as a brother, and spared not Jacob my father.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:10
verses.text: But his God and the God of his fathers sent forth His angel, and delivered him out of my hands.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:11
verses.text: For when I went into Shechem to bring ointment for the flocks, and Reuben to Dotham, where were our necessaries and all our stores, Judah our brother sold him to the Ishmaelites.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:12
verses.text: And when Reuben came he was grieved, for he wished to have restored him safe to his father.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:13
verses.text: But I was wroth against Judah in that he let him go away alive, and for five months I continued wrathful against him; but God restrained me, and withheld from me all working of my hands, for my right hand was half withered for seven days.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:14
verses.text: And I knew, my children, that because of Joseph this happened to me, and I repented and wept; and I besought the Lord that He would restore my hand unto me, and that I might be kept from all pollution and envy, and from all folly.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:15
verses.text: For I knew that I had devised an evil deed before the Lord and Jacob my father, on account of Joseph my brother, in that I envied him.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:16
verses.text: And now, children, take heed of the spirit of deceit and of envy.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:17
verses.text: For envy ruleth over the whole mind of a man, and suffereth him neither to eat, nor to drink, nor to do any good thing:  it ever suggesteth to him to destroy him that he envieth; and he that is envied ever flourisheth, but he that envieth fades away.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:18
verses.text: Two years of days I afflicted my soul with fasting in the fear of the Lord, and I learnt that deliverance from envy cometh by the fear of God.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:19
verses.text: If a man flee to the Lord, the evil spirit runneth away from him, and his mind becometh easy.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:20
verses.text: And henceforward he sympathizeth with him whom he envied, and condemneth not those who love him, and so ceaseth from his envy.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:21
verses.text: And my father asked concerning me, because he saw that I was sad; and I said, I am pained in my liver.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:22
verses.text: For I mourned more than they all, because I was guilty of the selling of Joseph.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:23
verses.text: And when we went down into Egypt, and he bound me as a spy, I knew that I was suffering justly, and I grieved not.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:24
verses.text: Now Joseph was a good man, and had the Spirit of God within him:  compassionate and pitiful, he bore not malice against me; nay, he loved me even as the rest of his brothers.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:25
verses.text: Take heed, therefore, my children, of all jealousy and envy, and walk in singleness of soul and with good heart, keeping in mind the brother of your father, that God may give to you also grace and glory, and blessing upon your heads, even as ye saw in him.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:26
verses.text: All his days he reproached us not concerning this thing, but loved us as his own soul, and beyond his own sons; and he glorified us, and gave riches, and cattle, and fruits freely to us all.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:27
verses.text: Do ye then also, my beloved children, love each one his brother with a good heart, and remove from you the spirit of envy, for this maketh savage the soul and destroyeth the body; it turneth his purposes into anger and war, and stirreth up unto blood, and leadeth the mind into frenzy, and suffereth not prudence to act in men:  moreover, it taketh away sleep, and causeth tumult to the soul and trembling to the body.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:28
verses.text: For even in sleep some malicious jealousy, deluding him, gnaweth at his soul, and with wicked spirits disturbeth it, and causeth the body to be troubled, and the mind to awake from sleep in confusion; and as though having a wicked and poisonous spirit, so appeareth it to men.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:29
verses.text: Therefore was Joseph fair in appearance, and goodly to look upon, because there dwelt not in him any wickedness; for in trouble of the spirit the face declareth it.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:30
verses.text: And now, my children, make your hearts good before the Lord, and your ways straight before men, and ye shall find grace before God and men.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:31
verses.text: And take heed not to commit fornication, for fornication is mother of all evils, separating from God, and bringing near to Beliar.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:32
verses.text: For I have seen it inscribed in the writing of Enoch that your sons shall with you be corrupted in fornication, and shall do wrong against Levi with the sword.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:33
verses.text: But they shall not prevail against Levi, for he shall wage the war of the Lord, and shall conquer all your hosts; and there shall be a few divided in Levi and Judah, and there shall be none of you for sovereignty, even as also my father Jacob prophesied in his blessings.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:34
verses.text: Behold, I have foretold you all things, that I may be clear from the sin of your souls.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:35
verses.text: Now, if ye remove from you your envy, and all your stiffneckedness, as a rose shall my bones flourish in Israel, and as a lily my flesh in Jacob, and my odour shall be as the odour of Libanus; and as cedars shall holy ones be multiplied from me for ever, and their branches shall stretch afar off.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:36
verses.text: Then shall perish the seed of Canaan, and a remnant shall not be to Amalek, and all the Cappadocians shall perish, and all the Hittites shall be utterly destroyed.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:37
verses.text: Then shall fail the land of Ham, and every people shall perish.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:38
verses.text: Then shall all the earth rest from trouble, and all the world under heaven from war.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:39
verses.text: Then shall Shem be glorified, because the Lord God, the Mighty One of Israel, shall appear upon earth as man, and saved by Him Adam.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:40
verses.text: Then shall all the spirits of deceit be given to be trampled under foot, and men shall rule over the wicked spirits.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:41
verses.text: Then will I arise in joy, and will bless the Most High because of His marvellous works, because God hath taken a body and eaten with men and saved men.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:42
verses.text: And now, my children, obey Levi, and in Judah shall ye be redeemed:  and be not lifted up against these two tribes, for from them shall arise to you the salvation of God.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:43
verses.text: For the Lord shall raise up from Levi as it were a Priest, and from Judah as it were a King, God and man.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:44
verses.text: So shall He save all the Gentiles and the race of Israel.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:45
verses.text: Therefore I command you all things, in order that ye also may command your children, that they may observe them throughout their generations.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:46
verses.text: And Simeon made an end of commanding his sons, and slept with his fathers, being an hundred and twenty years old.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:47
verses.text: And they laid him in a coffin of incorruptible wood, to take up his bones to Hebron.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:48
verses.text: And they carried them up in a war of the Egyptians secretly:  for the bones of Joseph the Egyptians guarded in the treasure-house of the palace; for the sorcerers told them that at the departure of the bones of Joseph there should be throughout the whole of Egypt darkness and gloom, and an exceeding great plague to the Egyptians, so that even with a lamp a man should not recognise his brother.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Simeon 1:49
verses.text: And the sons of Simeon bewailed their father according to the law of mourning, and they were in Egypt until the day of their departure from Egypt by the hand of Moses.
